respx.name: respx
respx.description: A utility for mocking out the Python HTTPX and HTTP Core libraries.

repo.name: respx
repo.description: Mock HTTPX with awesome request patterns and response side effects 🦋

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and quick start with clear examples, but lacks troubleshooting guidance and detailed configuration documentation in the README itself.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section for common issues like mock conflicts, import errors, or debugging failed route matches

common_complaints: URL parsing edge cases (double slashes, fragments, encoded characters)
Missing helper methods for assertion/verification
Error messages could be more helpful for debugging
Confusion about mocking scope and pass-through behavior
sentiment.summary: respx shows healthy engagement with a mix of bug reports and feature requests, with moderate maintainer response suggesting active but not rapid development.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2025-11-17)
25 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicating no maintenance
No merged PRs in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release process has stalled
maintenance.summary: The respx package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity in the past 6 months despite an initial recent commit, accumulating 25 unresolved issues.

project_metrics.description: Mock HTTPX with awesome request patterns and response side effects 🦋

concerns: High bus factor risk (90% from top contributor)

robotframework.name: robotframework
robotframework.description: Generic automation framework for acceptance testing and robotic process automation (RPA)

repo.name: robotframework
repo.description: Generic automation framework for acceptance testing and RPA

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and installation docs with solid quick start example, but lacks configuration details and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section for common errors and limited documentation on configuration options beyond command-line basics

common_complaints: Inconsistent and counterintuitive suite initialization behavior
AST parsing edge cases with comments and separators
Missing CLI-level timeout enforcement for test execution
Incomplete documentation on standard library limitations (Telnet with Python 3.12+)
JUnit XML output format issues with nested structures
Missing visibility into Robot Framework version in generated reports
praise_themes: Deliberate deprecation planning with clear roadmap (Testdoc deprecation in 7.5, removal in 8.0)
Responsive to feature requests with prioritization labels
sentiment.summary: Robot Framework shows active maintenance with clear deprecation policies and feature roadmap, but users report gaps in edge case handling, documentation completeness, and CLI functionality.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2025-12-23)
No closed issues in past 6 months with 275 open issues
No merged PRs in past 6 months
No active contributors in past 6 months
positive_signals: Repository exists and has some recent activity (commit on 2025-12-23)
Open PRs queue is clear (0 open)
maintenance.summary: robotframework shows signs of being stale with no maintenance activity for 6 months, despite a recent commit timestamp that may indicate an anomaly or automated process.

project_metrics.description: Generic automation framework for acceptance testing and RPA
